alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 06 at 4:36AM AKST until March 06 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Storm total accumulations of 4 to 7 inches are expected. Visibility less than one half mile at times. * WHERE...Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country. * WHEN...Until noon Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will continue into Sunday morning. West winds gusting to 40 mph will develop this morning along the Alaska Highway and cause blowing and drifting snow with low visibility. The winds and blowing snow will taper off Sunday afternoon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow and blowing snow means periods of snow and blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
